data.title: Restart in a Multitarget Debugging rotates targets in the dropdown list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: Win10x64

First of all thank you for this feature! No longer need I to nest projects and open multiple windows. But there is an inconvenience problem...

![](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/105338698/ShareX/2016-12/2016-12-16_17-10-28.gif)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a compound launch config with ['server', 'client']
2. launch it
3. restart 'server'

Desired behavior: 'server' is still selected in target dropdown option list.

What actually happens: 'client' gets selected

Why? Because the dropdown list removes the 'server' from the stack ->'client' becomes the only item so it gets selected -> new 'server' instance gets pushed into the list, but doesn't get reselected. If you restart once more - the same happens only with roles switched. They start to rotate.

So, if I'm used to restart via a hotkey - I normally don't look at what launch config is currently running - I just know it. If I'm now focused on the server-side development I probably want the selected target stay selected in the list because I want to restart it often. Without reselecting it manually every time.

Thank you.

data.title: Keep filtering suggestModel.ts after space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: any

Imagine you have a language where you can have identifiers with spaces (for example T-SQL). 
Identifiers with spaces are quoted, for example "My Table".

I have a language server with code completion capabilities. When code completion is triggered, my language server returns a list of quoted identifiers, for example "My Table", "Other Table", etc.

Then the user starts typing:
- My -> completion list is narrowed down to one entry. This is done automatically by vscode in suggestModel.ts
- Space -> completion is now cancelled by the suggest model. isDifferentContext returns true because it detects a space, [shouldRetrigger](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/6090d4b8ff89eefc91bdbec78dbd432a18a3562e/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/common/suggestModel.ts#L118-L121) returns false because it thinks it's a different line. But even if this line passes, re-triggering will happen only in automatic mode, but not in manual.
As a result, suggestion list is cancelled altogether and there is nothing one can do about it.

@jrieken, what do you think about this scenario? Would it be possible to resolve this somehow? I can send more information from the language server, for example if "My is typed, I know it's the part of identifier, so a subsequent space should keep filtering. Otherwise, if only My is typed, then space should probably cancel the suggestions as it does today. Then this would be similar to how Management Studio intellisense works.

This issue is quite annoying for our users because half of the identifiers in the codebase contains spaces :)

data.title: [Suggestion] add DocBlock snippet functions for many languages

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I know it is very easy to create your own snippet for it but I'd prefer the automatic creation of DocBlocks

This package for Atom.IO called [DocBlockr](https://atom.io/packages/docblockr) is a perfect idea of what I want. It's a shame there is no plugins for this on VSCode but i'm sure a lot of people would love this feature!

At the moment I'm having to use Atom to write up my API Documentation and it's a pain having to switch between editors

If you don't know what docblocks are look up JavaDoc or [phpDocumentor](https://www.phpdoc.org/)

To clarify: No this is not just creating snippets, It's reading the below function and automatically creating a document block

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

With 1.7 extensions worked fine.  Now on 1.8 it is ignoring the environment variables.  Doing a packet capture you can see it going direct.  I tried adding the setting for proxy in user settings still not working. It also says that https_proxy is not a setting.  My setting for the proxy are with authentication.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Environment Variable set for http_proxy and https_proxy. 
2. Extension tries going direct instead of proxy.
3. Doing 'Check for Updates' goes through proxy.

data.title: Add provision to apply functions to variables within snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version:


Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 32222e2eefc7a0afe9a1a0ecb4794119efd9bc81
Date 2016-12-16T07:18:07.856Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:

Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

Currently snippets does not have any way to apply functions to the variable being edited.

For eg., if the user selects `ng2-component` template using [this](https://github.com/johnpapa/vscode-angular2-snippets) plugin, user needs to enter the same name in multiple places

1. in lowercase for the selector name
2. in Camelcase for the class name

If vscode supports applying functions to the template variables names, the extension developer can write functions to update the rest of the template using this the text captured within this variable

data.title: Make high contrast detection configurable
data.body:
Add a new option 'window.autoDetectHighContrast', defaults to true. If false, VS Code theme will ignore Windows High Contrast theme.

Fixes #17279

data.title: Zen mode bugs?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: linux Mint

Hello,
Was just glad about the new zen mode when noticed 2 possible bugs.

**First bug:** file focus is reset
_Steps to reproduce_:
 - open some files from project
 - open key unofficial file (such as Preferences->User settings, or something similar)
 - focus on the settings.json
 - zen mode triggered
 - 2x Esc
 - the focus jumps to another file

Note, I noticed that after some time (or maybe after I have done something), this couldn't be reproduce anymore until restarted.

Edited: Same goes for toggle sidebar (the problem is probably from here). If I focus on the settings.json and then hit toggle sidebar ... :boom:,  jumps to the first non settings.json tab

**Second bug**: stuck in zen :D
_Steps to reproduce_:
 - i set the shortcut for zen as F11
 - hold F11 - yeah... took like 30s and got stuck in something like full screen (no window or menu bar, just sidebar and editor

data.title: debugger disconnects after setting a breakpoint
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 (also tested on 1.7.2)
- OS: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Set a breakpoint on 2nd line;
2. Run node debugger;
3. press F10 (Step Over);
4. press F9 (set a breakpoint on current paused line [3rd line])

Note 1: it seems to be a floating bug, because sometimes it can't be reproduced on 4th step, and then we need to unset breakpoint and set it again (maybe even many times).

Note 2: if after 3rd step remove a breakpoint on 2nd line (then no one active breakpoints left) then 4th step will not cause this bug.

My sample filename is 'Файл.js' (it's important to make filename with cyrillic symbols, because i can't reproduce it in file with latin name)
My sample code is
```
let a = 34;
a += 23;
console.log(a);
```

my log with 'trace: all' option is

Debugger listening on [::]:20583

data.title: Feature: Add terminal.integrated.cwd
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0

This allows better support for fixed folder structure repository / multiple packages repositories.

For example, a repo look like this:

```sh
depot
- main
  - management
    - ui
      - frontend
        - web-portal
      - mobile
  - backend
  - tools
  - scripts
  - test
```

I need to open the "main" folder in code so I can access other codes, but my main focus of work is in "web-portal"

Currently, when I open the terminal, it starts in "/depot/main" and I have to "cd management/ui/frontend/web-portal" every time before I can do my work e.g. `npm test` or `npm i -D typescript`.

It would be nice to add a workspace setting `terminal.integrated.startPath` which take a relative or absolute path (in my case "./management/ui/frontend/web-portal").

data.title: Stepping in code always tries to center the current line vertically
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9 Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start debugging on a program that has a loop and about 40 lines before and after the loop
2. step through the loop

Observe: the source is always scrolled so that the current line (yellow) stays at the same position vertically.

This is a regression from the stable build.

data.title: Autocompletion deleting script reference in HTML
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)

|Extension|Author|Version|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Creating an HTML project 
2. Add script reference in it including type as first attribute and then the src with existing
- Like this one:   <script type="text/javascript" src="test.js"> </script> 
- Or just incliding the src like this :  <script src="test.js"> </script> 
3. The use auto-completion ( Maj+alt+F) and all script reference are remplaced by:  </script>
N.B.: if  only one script as the type attributes after src like this <script src="test.js" type="text/javascript" > </script> and is not the first referenced there is no more problem. If the reference script doesn't exists the reference isn't delede

data.title: Support 'restart' option on 'launch' configs too
data.body:
Since VS Code node debugging now supports 'npm' or other task runners directly in 'launch' configs, it is now possible to run 'nodemon' as part of this.
This was not (easily) possible before. Instead users would run nodemon from the command line and then use a VS Code 'attach' config to connect to it. 
To fully support the nodemon scenario with 'launch', we should support the 'restart' option not only for 'attach' but for 'launch' as well.

/cc @egamma

data.title: Add git push button and shortcut
data.body: Could you add a git push button to this bar? And probably add a shortcut? I think having to click the dropdown is to much effort everytime I need to push. Using the command palette is also not very effortless.

data.title: Cannot attach debugger to a node.js application running inside a Docker container in host-mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.7 & v1.8
- OS Version:  macOS 10.12.1

I'm trying to attach the Visual Studio Code debugger to a node.js app that is running inside a Docker container in host-mode.

    DEBUG=* /usr/bin/node --debug-brk /home/app/node_modules/homebridge/bin/homebridge -- -U /home/data -P /home/app

Command:

    docker run -it --rm --net="host" \
        --name homebridge \
        -p "51826:51826" -p "5858:5858" \
        -v `pwd`:/home/app \
        dev/homebridge

using default launch.json:

    {
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Docker: Attach to Node",
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5858,
            "address": "localhost",
            "restart": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outFiles": [],
            "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "remoteRoot": "/home/app"
        }
    ]}

Diagnose:

    Docker for Mac: version: 1.12.3 (583d1b8)
    OS X: version 10.12.1 (build: 16B2555)
    logs: /tmp/E06B6538-E61C-41B8-81C0-90EB5A538452/20161204-214523.tar.gz
    [OK]     vmnetd
    [OK]     dns
    [OK]     driver.amd64-linux
    [OK]     virtualization VT-X
    [OK]     app
    [OK]     moby
    [OK]     system
    [OK]     moby-syslog
    [OK]     db
    [OK]     env
    [OK]     virtualization kern.hv_support
    [OK]     slirp
    [OK]     osxfs
    [OK]     moby-console
    [OK]     logs
    [OK]     docker-cli
    [OK]     menubar
    [OK]     disk
    Failure: Could not upload diagnostic data to remote server (docker-diagnose exit code is 1)


Now, when I start the application and attach the debugger i get:

**Cannot connect to runtime process (timeout after 10000 ms).**

However, if I start the container without the host mode (docker run -it --rm --name ...), then it works...

Any idea ???

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: None

---

The first Q&A from [Common Questions](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings#_common-questions) does not work.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open `Keyboard Shortcuts` (Ctrl+k Ctrl+S)
2. Click to focus on the `Default Shortcuts`, by default the focus is on the `User Shortcuts` panel
3. Open `Quick Outline/Goto Symbol` (Ctrl+Shift+O)
4. You see the results from the `User Shortcuts` and not the `Default` ones
5. If you hit `ESC` you can see the focus is on the `User Shortcuts` from the right panel

data.title: Version 1.8 Import completion displays multiple versions of the same package
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.0 (1.8.0) - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install react via npm to a local folder and open the project in vscode. 2. use ES6 import syntax to import the react component. 3. The autocomplete will display multiple versions of react. 4. It does this for numerous packages. 5. See attached screen shot. I would expect it to only display one match for each package in the node_modules folder.
